item.title: JJ Furniture - Predictive Model
item.description: Using the fake data created from JJ Furniture - Data Model, I implemented a popular supervised machine learning algorithm xgboost for customer cross-sell prediction.

item.title: Big Rock - Analysis
item.description: Illustrating some light analysis and data visualization using R with the data acquired from Big Rock - Web Scraping post.

item.title: JJ Furniture - Data Model
item.description: A colleague and I collaborated on an AWS project to deepen our understanding of data engineering and to help build out our portfolio. We simulated a fake furniture company’s data to make it more realistc and fun.

item.title: Big Rock - Web Scrape
item.description: A blue marlin fishing tournament called The Big Rock is an exciting event held each year in Eastern North Carolina. For the past 7 years I have used python to pull some interesting data from the website. In this post I display how.

Who Am I? My name is Julian Swart and I hold a Master’s in Business Analytics from the University of Tennessee. I started this website to show my enthusiam for statistics, programming, and problem-solving. More generally, I am interested in business, math, philosophy, and economics.
